input: Charlie is furry. Erin is quiet. Erin is smart. Fiona is kind. Fiona is not quiet. Fiona is rough. Gary is not cold. Gary is furry. Gary is green. Gary is kind. Gary is quiet. Gary is rough. All cold, kind things are not furry. Smart things are cold. If something is cold then it is rough. If something is rough and cold then it is kind. If Fiona is kind then Fiona is rough. All furry, smart things are green. If something is cold and not furry then it is green. Question: Erin is not green.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Furry Charlie
axiom T2 : Quiet Erin
axiom T3 : Smart Erin
axiom T4 : Kind Fiona
axiom T5 : ¬ Quiet Fiona
axiom T6 : Rough Fiona
axiom T7 : ¬ Cold Gary
axiom T8 : Furry Gary
axiom T9 : Green Gary
axiom T10 : Kind Gary
axiom T11 : Quiet Gary
axiom T12 : Rough Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ Kind x → ¬ Furry x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Cold x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x → Rough x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Cold x → Kind x
axiom R5 : Kind Fiona → Rough Fiona
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Smart x → Green x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ ¬ Furry x → Green x

theorem erin_is_not_green : ¬ Green Erin :=
begin
  intro H,
  apply R1 Erin,
  split,
  apply R2,
  exact T3,
  apply R6,
  split,
  apply R6 Erin,
  split,
  exact H,
  exact T3,
  exact H,
end

-- The answer is True
